channel.title: ::dp?
channel.description: I really want a ::dp command or something of the sort. Anyways the point is i know its like spawn item at absyx; and stuff i just dont get it anyway you could give me the code? for a command that drops stuff around the player? possibly random stuff? id love to repay in any way i can!

item.title: ::dp?
item.dc:creator: @eballer48 eballer48
item.description:
@eballer48 wrote:

oh yes. i feel like a dumbass. yes i have this code already.
the thing is id like the items to be random.

Read full topic

item.title: ::dp?

item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

The other code is part of the command if you’ll look, its just smaller (3 items).

Read full topic

item.title: ::dp?
item.dc:creator: @eballer48 eballer48
item.description:
@eballer48 wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:2, topic:343295”]Its actually easier than you would think, just use a simple Array

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("dp")) { int[] partyItems = { 35, 667, 4151 }; for (int i = 0; i < partyItems.length; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < 20; j++) { createGroundItem(partyItems[i], absX + misc.random(5), absY + misc.random(5), 1); } } }
This will spawn 20 Items in a 5 by 5 square in front of your character. The only thing you really need to edit will be the Array

int[] partyItems = { itemA, itemB, itemC, itemD, ect, ect, ect };

Assuming you use a 317 of course.[/quote]
okay so i add the command in client.java of course but the other code also in client.java?

Read full topic

item.title: ::dp?
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Its actually easier than you would think, just use a simple Array

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("dp")) { int[] partyItems = { 35, 667, 4151 }; for (int i = 0; i < partyItems.length; i++) { for (int j = 0; j < 20; j++) { createGroundItem(partyItems[i], absX + misc.random(5), absY + misc.random(5), 1); } } }
This will spawn 20 Items in a 5 by 5 square in front of your character. The only thing you really need to edit will be the Array

int[] partyItems = { itemA, itemB, itemC, itemD, ect, ect, ect };

Assuming you use a 317 of course.

Read full topic
